page.title: 06COMMUNITY,CAREW AREA,TENBY.
page.content: Attitudes within the community have changed over recent years.This used to be a very close knit community.Housing developments have now changed this and resulted in an influx from outside areas.These new inhabitants are still considered'outsiders'in the community. There are communal activities _ youth club,church anniversaries and O.A.P.'s dinners_all of which attempt to bring the'old'and'new'communities together. Although people are not quite as close as they used to be, most do join together when faced with problems or threats to the community,e.g.recently a private firm applied for permission to site an incinerator on the disused aerodrome.The locals joined together to oppose this development. Their main worry was over possible fumes and pollution.The strenth of opposition resulted in the plans being dropped.
